text: [Music]
really high up in the stratosphere
during winter months higher than where
we find our normal clouds a blob of cold
air spins over the Arctic it spins like
t word in your mug after you've stirred
it really fast the tea swirls fast and
high at the edges of the mug forming a
bit of a dip in the center now pause for
a second and think of what happens once
the tea slows down the tea naturally
rushes back inwards and a similar thing
can happen over the Arctic if the cold
blobs spin slower the air will rush back
inwards and what happens with this air
were more often than not the air will
sink through the atmosphere become
warmer and even spin in the opposite way
and this in turn can reverse our jet
stream and in time mild westerly winds
become cold
easterlies from Siberia increasing the
chances of a snowman at home
